blocks.text: The NorCal 40A is a QRP CW transceiver kit for the 40-meter band, designed by Wayne Burdick (N6KR) and produced by the NorCal QRP Club. It features a VXO (Variable Crystal Oscillator) for frequency control and a single-conversion superhet receiver.
The transceiver includes an internal audio-derived AGC, built-in sidetone oscillator, and electronic T/R switching for semi-break-in CW operation.
This manual was extracted from a scanned document. Content may be limited. Refer to the PDF for complete information.
The NorCal 40A uses simple front-panel controls for frequency tuning and volume. The main tuning control adjusts the VXO frequency across the operating range.
The NorCal 40A supports connection of external paddles or a straight key. A built-in sidetone oscillator provides audio feedback during transmit.
Keyer functionality depends on kit version and options installed. Refer to the PDF manual for keying specifications.
The receiver uses crystal filtering at the IF frequency for selectivity. The audio section includes filtering optimized for CW reception.
Audio-derived AGC provides automatic gain control to handle varying signal strengths.
The NorCal 40A operates from a DC power supply. Low current consumption makes it suitable for portable operation with battery power.
Refer to the PDF manual for specific voltage requirements and current consumption figures.
The NorCal 40A does not include an internal antenna tuner. Use an external tuner if operating with non-resonant antennas.
The PDF manual contains complete specifications. This is a scanned document and text extraction was limited.
Refer to the PDF manual for troubleshooting guidance and alignment procedures.
Most kit-related issues trace to soldering problems. Inspect all connections with magnification if experiencing issues.
